intro: Persoonia acerosa, commonly known as the serrated geebung, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Persoonia acerosa is typically found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is an important species for local wildlife, providing nectar for various pollinators.
